image.altText: Man in trucker hat walking outside of court.

props.synopsis: The NT Supreme Court trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright has been delayed for three weeks. It comes as his defence team seeks thousands of pages of mobile phone records from a witness.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright's trial delayed, amid clash over witness phone records

image.altText: A rainbow flag waving outside of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The NT government has walked back on its plans to scrap hate speech protections in the territory's anti-discrimination laws. However there are still fears the changes will "water down" laws against vilification.

title.children: NT government accused of 'watering down' anti-discrimination laws

image.altText: A politician with blonde hair, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general has revealed a $300,000 racism review into the NT Police Force has been scrapped, with the funding redirected to Legal Aid.

title.children: NT police racism review scrapped, funding redirected

image.altText: A Timor-Leste player kicking a soccer ball onto the field.

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste representatives say the national soccer team's victory in an Asian Cup qualifier in Darwin isn't just about boosting its chances in the competition, but is also a powerful showcase of culture and community.

title.children: Soccer strengthening cultural ties as Top End hosts Timor-Leste

image.altText: Alexander's daughter in the snow

props.synopsis: While the weather might be drastically different in Tasmania and the NT during winter, the social calendar is equally busy.

title.children: The magic of winter in Tasmania, and the 'chill' in Darwin

image.altText: A person hauls nets and marine debris buried underneath the white sand at a beach in Arnhem Land

props.synopsis: It's rubbish season in northern Australia, when tonnes of plastic and discarded fishing nets wash ashore in the Gulf of Carpentaria. But the future of funding for clean-up patrols is unclear.

title.children: Gulf ghost-net patrols fear tide turning in fight to save remote beaches

props.synopsis: The Maroons keep the Origin series alive after a stunning comeback from the Blues fell just short in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Maroons hold off stunning Blues comeback in Origin classic to keep series alive

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Optus admits to engaging in unconscionable conduct and agrees to a $100 million penalty for selling customers phones and contracts they did not want or need.

title.children: Optus faces $100m penalty for unconscionable conduct

image.altText: jim chalmers press club

props.synopsis: The treasurer used a National Press Club address to declare he had an open mind on including tax changes as part of a package of reforms considered in August's round table.

title.children: Chalmers vows to 'dial-up' Labor's ambition for 'bold' tax reform

image.altText: A boy being tackled and arrested on a footpath

props.synopsis: A court hears horrific details of how a group of teenagers used the promise of sex over Grindr to lure men to secluded areas of Perth to brutally attack them.

title.children: Teens who used Grindr to set up brutal, violent ambushes on men sentenced

image.altText: A woman smiling in a field with trees behind her.

props.synopsis: A Queensland man accused of murdering his wife and staging a lawnmower accident as a cover-up has been charged with breaching his strict bail conditions.

title.children: RAAF pilot accused of wife's murder charged with breaching bail

image.altText: A man wearing a fur cape, and surrounded by a large crowd, walks up stairs.

props.synopsis: Cheers erupted among the thousands of people gathered on the steps of Victoria Parliament as the Yoorrook Justice Commissioner reached his destination after 508 kilometres and 25 days of walking.

title.children: Lionel was taken as a baby. A 500km walk connected him with family

image.altText: Protesters hold up signs opposing the Trump administration's travel ban on countries, with one saying "No Hate No Ban".

props.synopsis: Pacific Island nations Tonga, Vanuatu and Tuvalu are reported to be facing US travel bans, but officials say they are yet to learn why.

title.children: Three Pacific nations face US travel bans — and officials don't know why

image.altText: a balding man in police uniform

props.synopsis: More details have been revealed about the shooting which claimed the life of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith, including that Special Operations Group personnel at the property to assist were not in their gear when the shooting happened.

title.children: More details revealed about shooting of Tasmania Police officer

image.altText: Trump salutes while wearing red MAGA hat

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made a lot of promises on foreign policy, but perhaps the loudest has been America First. If he breaks it, he will have a MAGA-sized problem.

title.children: As Trump contemplates Iran, he risks a MAGA meltdown

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and a wide smile wearing a pink and blur floral dress, standing with her hand on her hip

props.synopsis: The star of Mystery Road exposes a dark chapter of Australian history in her second novel, I Am Nannertgarrook.

title.children: Tasma Walton's new novel reveals Australia's hidden history of slavery

image.altText: A man being led by multiple police officers into the back of a paddy wagon.

props.synopsis: The four males have been charged with multiple offences including aggravated sexual assault and sexual intercourse without consent, with two expected to appear in court on Wednesday.

title.children: Alleged gang rape of 17yo girl in Sydney 'will affect her life forever'

image.altText: A sign that is blue, white and grey that reads MSI United Kingdom Reproductive Choices Central London.

props.synopsis: The vote to decriminalise abortion was made to stop a growing number of women from being investigated by police for terminating their pregnancies.

title.children: UK parliament votes to decriminalise abortion, repealing 19th-century law

image.altText: Two people now charged over alleged kidnap and torture of teenager

props.synopsis: A Cairns magistrate hears the man threatened an allegedly tortured 19-year-old woman with a replica gun and made her write a "demeaning" apology to a co-accused. Three people have been charged with multiple offences.

title.children: Kidnapping accused forced bloodied teen to write apology, court hears

image.altText: A man's forearm focused at the interior of the elbow with a needle injected withdrawing blood.

props.synopsis: Restrictions around sexually active gay and bisexual men donating blood and plasma are being loosened in a new world-leading move by Australian Red Cross Lifeblood.

title.children: World-leading changes to sexual activity rules for blood, plasma donating

image.altText: large, orange mushroom cloud takes up the evening sky over a woman standing outside her house

props.synopsis: Passengers are left stranded as flights are cancelled due to one of Indonesia's most active volcanoes erupting and spewing hot ash and smoke plumes.

title.children: Erupting Indonesian volcano grounds Australian passengers bound for Bali

image.altText: A man in a royal blue suit, white shirt and light blue tie sits in a room with red carpet looking toward something out of frame

props.synopsis: General He Weidong, China's second-ranking military official and a co-vice-chairman of the powerful Central Military Commission, has not been seen in public since March.

title.children: Beijing's inner circle fractures as Xi's top military official disappears

image.altText: three men in room talking.

props.synopsis: Thai police say more than a dozen foreigners, mostly Australians and British, were arrested for allegedly running an online investment fraud that duped people out of at least $1.9 million.

title.children: Thai police bust multimillion-dollar investment scam targeting Australians

image.altText: a crude oil tanker sails away from the camera in foggy murky waters

props.synopsis: The government says "Russia uses these vessels to circumvent international sanctions and sustain its illegal and immoral war against Ukraine".

title.children: Australia hits Russia's 'deceptive' shadow fleet with sanctions

image.altText: GettyImages-2217989547

props.synopsis: Officials reveal a 15 per cent increase in prize money, taking the purse for this week's Women's PGA Championship in Texas to $18.5 million.

title.children: Aussie golfers eye equal-biggest purse in LPGA history

image.altText: a flat triangle shaped black plane flies high over an airbase

props.synopsis: It is thought bunker-buster bombs — the kind only possessed by the United States — are required to significantly damage Iran's key Fordow nuclear fuel enrichment plant.

title.children: Why Israel can't destroy Iran's nuclear site under a mountain on its own

image.altText: Brad Lander being placed under arrest with multiple ICE enforcement trying to grab him

props.synopsis: Brad Lander's arrest for the alleged assault of a federal officer is the latest confrontation between US ICE agents and Democratic politicians.

title.children: ICE arrests New York mayoral candidate for alleged assault

image.altText: Spurs manager Ange Postecoglou looks past a smiling chairman Daniel Levy as they shake hands after a big win.

props.synopsis: Spurs chairman Daniel Levy speaks for the first time about the sacking of Ange Postecoglou, saying he does not regret appointing the Australian but defends the dismissal as a difficult but correct call.

title.children: 'We've made the right decision': Spurs' Levy defends Postecoglou sacking

image.altText: HMAS Toowoomba

props.synopsis: The PM rules out deploying Australian naval assets to the Middle East even as European leaders mull support for a possible US intervention.

title.children: PM rules out deploying Australian naval assets to Middle East

image.altText: A woman with black hair and a fringe.

props.synopsis: A Lismore man pleads guilty to assaulting Lindy Lucena eight days before her death, but maintains his plea of not guilty to murder.

title.children: Man accused of partner's murder pleads guilty to earlier assault

image.altText: Next ATM in a closed tobacconist in Burpengary

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation finds that among investments raking in the dollars for the Australian-founded Macquarie Group is the nation's billion-dollar illegal tobacco trade.

title.children: Macquarie Group-backed private ATMs are helping fuel the illegal tobacco trade

image.altText: Two men in suits walking from the right of frame to left.

props.synopsis: A magistrate finds the prosecution had not proven "beyond reasonable doubt" that the police officer used a restricted QPS database to track the whereabouts of his former partner.

title.children: Police officer found not guilty of using database to track former partner

image.altText: A smiling woman sits with her laughing daughter on her lap.

props.synopsis: A Sydney mother is calling for change after being told her daughter with disability would have to wait five months for a scan her doctor said was urgent.

title.children: 5yo girl with growth in ear told to wait five months for scan
